## Analysis

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
photo <- read.csv("face/data/face_photosynthesis.csv")
photo$DayDate <- paste(photo$Date, "_01", sep="")
photo$DayDate <- as.Date(photo$DayDate, format="%b_%Y_%d")
xlab <- " "
alab <- "a"
blab <- "b"
library(doBy)
library(sciplot)
photolab <- expression(italic(A)[net]~~(mu*mol~m^-2~s^-1))
rrlab <- expression(CO[2]~Response~Ratio)
photo_co2 <- summaryBy(Anet ~ DayDate + treatment, data=photo, FUN=c(mean,se), na.rm=TRUE)
photo_eco2 <- subset(photo_co2, treatment == "eCO2", select= c(DayDate, Anet.mean, Anet.se, treatment))
photo_aco2 <- subset(photo_co2, treatment == "aCO2", select= c(DayDate, Anet.mean, Anet.se, treatment))
photo_format <- merge(photo_aco2, photo_eco2, by= "DayDate")
photo_format$ratio <- (photo_format$Anet.mean.y)/(photo_format$Anet.mean.x)
```


## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
par(mfrow=c(2,1), mar=c(0,0,0,0), oma=c(5,5,1,1))
plot(photo_format$DayDate, photo_format$Anet.mean.x, ylim= c(15, 32),
     xaxt="n", type="o",pch=20, col="forestgreen")
points(photo_format$DayDate, photo_format$Anet.mean.y, type="o", pch=20, col="green")
with(photo_format, arrows(DayDate, Anet.mean.x, DayDate, Anet.mean.x + Anet.se.x, angle=90, length=0.03))
with(photo_format, arrows(DayDate, Anet.mean.x, DayDate, Anet.mean.x - Anet.se.x, angle=90, length=0.03))
with(photo_format, arrows(DayDate, Anet.mean.y, DayDate, Anet.mean.y + Anet.se.y, angle=90, length=0.03))
with(photo_format, arrows(DayDate, Anet.mean.y, DayDate, Anet.mean.y - Anet.se.y, angle=90, length=0.03))
text(x=min(photo_format$DayDate), y=31.5, alab, font=2)
legend("topright", levels(photo_format$treatment.x), pch=21,inset=0.01, 
       pt.bg= c("forestgreen", "green"), bty='n') 
axis(1, labels=FALSE)
mtext(photolab, side = 2, line = 3)
plot(ratio ~ DayDate, data=photo_format, ylim= c(1.0, 1.5), type= "o", pch=20, xlab="")
text(x=min(photo_format$DayDate), y=1.49, blab, font=2)
mtext(rrlab, side = 2, line = 3)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
